text.p: Tracor Flight Systems Inc said Wednesday it has secured a $20.8 million contract from the Air Force to deliver two fully equipped ASTRA SPX aircraft to replace C-21s now in operation.
Tracor Flight Systems, a subsidiary of Tracor Inc, said it will modify two executive business jet aircraft for use by the 201st Airlift Squadron of the Air National Guard.
The aircraft, which are to be delivered in late 1997, will be in use at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base in Ohio.
The company said the total value of the contract, with options, is about $47 million.
